metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15999 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - high
metadata.Description:
Heap buffer overflow in Freetype in Google Chrome prior to 86.0.4240.111allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via acrafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-15999` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

freetype2-demos - 2.6.1-0.1ubuntu2.5
libfreetype6 - 2.6.1-0.1ubuntu2.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: android package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '86.0.4240.198-0ubuntu0.16.04.1').
freetype package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.1-0.1ubuntu2.5').
